issues.title: Financial Data Contradiction
issues.message: The 'Amount Covered by Insurance' is stated as ₹0.00, while the 'Patient's Balance' is ₹350,000.00 for a total bill of ₹400,000.00. This implies ₹50,000.00 was covered, directly contradicting the stated 'Amount Covered by Insurance'. This inconsistency needs immediate clarification.
issues.suggested_action: Reconcile financial records with the insurance provider and the hospital's billing department to clarify the actual covered amount and patient responsibility.
evidence: Amount Covered by Insurance: ₹0.00, Patient's Balance: ₹350000.00, Total Hospital Bill: ₹400000.00

issues.title: Approved Pre-authorization Not Reflected in Coverage
issues.message: Despite an active policy, cashless coverage type, and an approved pre-authorization for ₹500,000.00 (which is greater than the total bill of ₹400,000.00), the 'Amount Covered by Insurance' is reported as ₹0.00. This indicates that the expected insurance coverage has not been applied to the bill, preventing a smooth discharge.
issues.suggested_action: Contact Red Insurance immediately to ascertain why the approved pre-authorization has not resulted in coverage for the bill. Verify if all procedures billed align with the pre-authorized services and if any deductibles, co-pays, or non-covered services are impacting the claim.
evidence: Policy Status: active, Coverage Type: Cashless, Pre-authorization Status: approved (PA-2024-00231), Approved Amount: 500000.0, Total Hospital Bill: 400000.0, Amount Covered by Insurance: 0.0

issues.title: Pharmacy Order Pending
issues.message: The pharmacy order for Jondise (RX-002) is currently pending and has not been dispensed.
issues.suggested_action: Contact pharmacy to expedite dispensing of Jondise.

issues.title: Missing Pharmacy Order
issues.message: Insulin Glargine is listed as a discharge medication but no corresponding pharmacy order was found or processed.
issues.suggested_action: Create and process a pharmacy order for Insulin Glargine immediately.

issues.title: Potential Allergy Conflict
issues.message: Dolo-Crosine (Acetaminophen Extended) is prescribed for a patient with a known 'Liver complaint' allergy. Acetaminophen can be hepatotoxic.
issues.suggested_action: Review Dolo-Crosine prescription with prescribing physician. Consider alternative medication or dose adjustment, and ensure liver function monitoring is in place.

issues.title: Payment Pending for Discharge Medications
issues.message: Payment status for all discharge medications (Dolo-Crosine, Jondise, Insulin Glargine) is pending.
issues.suggested_action: Ensure patient or insurance clears payment for all discharge medications before release.

issues.title: Ambulance Transport Required
issues.message: Patient has a serious condition (Liver Cancer) requiring medical supervision during transport. An ALS ambulance is recommended due to the diagnosis and existing condition of excess panting.
issues.suggested_action: Proceed with booking an ALS ambulance with City Emergency Ambulance (AMB-001).

issues.title: Final Invoice Not Generated
issues.message: The final invoice for patient P00231 (account ACC-00231-2024) has not yet been generated. Discharge cannot be completed without a finalized bill.
issues.suggested_action: Generate the final invoice for patient P00231. Ensure all charges are captured and approved.

issues.title: Pending Billing Adjustments
issues.message: There are pending adjustments that need to be finalized before discharge. This includes insurance pre-authorization and dialysis procedure billing, which could impact the final patient responsibility.
issues.suggested_action: Expedite approval for insurance pre-authorization and finalize billing for the dialysis procedure. Update the patient's account accordingly.

issues.title: Required lab test pending
issues.message: The 'Chest X-Ray' test is required for discharge but its status is 'pending'. It has not been completed before the discharge clearance time.
issues.suggested_action: Ensure Chest X-Ray is completed and results are reviewed by a physician before discharge.

issues.title: Critical lab value detected
issues.message: RBC value of 2.8 10^6/uL is critically low (reference range: 4.5-5.9, critical threshold: 3.0).
issues.suggested_action: Consult with physician for immediate review and intervention regarding critical RBC level.

issues.title: Critical lab value detected
issues.message: Platelets value of 960 10^3/uL is critically high (reference range: 150-400, critical threshold: 450).
issues.suggested_action: Consult with physician for immediate review and intervention regarding critical Platelets level.

issues.title: Critical lab value detected
issues.message: Hemoglobin value of 8.2 g/dL is critically low (reference range: 13.5-17.5, critical threshold: 10.0).
issues.suggested_action: Consult with physician for immediate review and intervention regarding critical Hemoglobin level.
